DOC.criteria: Adult patient , 18 75 year age Diagnosis Psoriatic Arthritis ( Moll Wright CASPAR criterion ) > /= 6 month duration Have > /= 3 swell > /= 3 tender joint Inadequate response current previous oral DMARD NSAID therapy Current oral DMARDs must stable dose appropriate duration ( e.g . 14 day sulfasalazine 28 day methotrexate oral steroid ) NSAIDs maximum recommend dose permit stable dose least 14 day prior first dose study drug , one NSAID simultaneously ( except lowdose aspirin cardioprotection ) Body mass index ( BMI ) 18 42 kg/m2 inclusive Previous prolong treatment biologic DMARD ; use biologic DMARD within 3 month 5 time elimination halflive ( whichever longer ) prior first dose study drug Previous use Bcell deplete biologic DMARDs Any previous treatment alkylating agent cyclophosphamide chlorambucil total lymphoid irradiation History current inflammatory joint disease psoriatic arthritis ; Gout pseudogout current active within past 6 month Positive hepatitis B , hepatitis C HIV infection Any acquire congenital immune deficiency history disease know cause significant alteration immunologic function Acute clinically significant infection 6 week prior administration study drug , history presence chronic infection , history recurrent infection adult
